questiontext.text: 30,000 telephone calls from the ICT department have a distribution with a mean duration of 173.9 seconds and a standard deviation of 184.8 seconds. You take two random samples of 20 and 80 calls, respectively. Which sample has a smaller variability?

answer.text: The sample of 20 has smaller variability.

feedback.text: The sample of 20 has smaller variability…: Incorrect

answer.text: The sample of 80 has smaller variability.

feedback.text: The sample of 80 has a smaller variability…: Correct

answer.text: Both samples have the same variability.

feedback.text: Both samples have the same variability…: Incorrect
